messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "mopr2002" <morten@k...> wrote:
> Hi. I read the documentation on junit.org, but it's not really clear
> to me how I actually share a fixture. I'm probably completely off
> track in regards to what the cookbook actually tries to explain,
> but I wish multiple tests (as separate classes) to work on a common
> set of fixtures. Is the proper way to have the fixtures as static
> variables in a separate class? From the documentation I gathered:

The desire for a shared fixture is a symptom of an opportunity to
reduce the coupling of your design. For example, I was working on a
system dealing with exchange rates. We had a global variable
(essentially) for storing the rates. Different tests wanted different
rates on different dates. We struggled with fancy schemes for only
installing rates at certain times. In the end, we passed the rates
into the routines that needed them, which made testing simpler, made
the "proper" home for the rates in the application obvious, and
enabled a bunch of other refactorings.

Kent
